content: granny square earrings by leigh manson-brown http //knit-errant blogspot com for now this is a really rough pattern i ll clean it up and add more pictures when my camera has fresh batteries and i have a better attention span hopefully later this weekend size 5 1 90 mm steel crochet hook 28 gauge wire 24 gauge wire 2 top-drilled briolette beads 4 4mm jump rings 2 shepherd s hook earring findings wire cutters round-nose pliers curved-nose pliers opt nylon-jaw pliers opt gauge gauge isn t important for this project however if you don t like how the wire is working up feel free to experiment with hook sizes skill level easy though some beading experience is recommended earring body round 1 with 28 gauge wire form a loop and twist it once or twice to close it chain 3 2 double_crochet in loop ch2 3dc three times chain 2 join to top loop of chain three with a slip_stitch cut wire weave in ends trim excess wire from center of square and at finishing join use small crochet hook knitting needle or pliers to shape and neaten wire work using nylon jaw pliers flatten squares alternately lay wirework on a flat surface and roll it with a dowel even a lipstick tube or large dpns you don t care about scratching will work assembling the earrings 1 wrap your briolettes if you don t know how here is a detailed tutorial http //home netcom com/~signal2noise/brio htm i want to get a tutorial done with pictures but i m lazy and just want to get this done this morning 2 open your jump rings don t open them by pulling the ends away from each other they ll distort instead pull the ends of the ring sideways think of it as making a c bad as opposed to making a small section of a spiral good 3 slip both one corner of your granny square and the loop of your briolette on the ring close the ring by sliding the ends back together 4 attach your ear wires by slipping your jump ring through the opposite corner of the granny square then sliding the loop at the bottom of the ear wire onto the jump ring close the jump ring 5 repeat for other earring hooray you should have earrings now and hopefully you don t want me to die a slow painful death no matter how slow and painful my tutorial is
